page.title: 06STREETS AND BUILDINGS-iv.
page.content:
West St.
West St. runs from the church to Northampton Rd. On the south side are old stone buildings which pre-date the fire which destroyed much of Old Earls Barton.A few stone buildings remain on the North side of the street. Next to the Hairdresser's are two stone cottages knocked into one.The present use is as a Doctor's Surgery but previously they made up a bakery where villagers took their Sunday lunch to be cooked.What is now a garage,used to be a public house called the "Horse Shoe" and a Cinema.A large Tannery has been taken over to become part of Mssrs Barkers new shoe factory complex.It had been the site of a tannery for hundreds of years
